greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table read by rows: the n-th row is the list of numbers above n in the table of natural numbers read by antidiagonals.
link: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: nn = 35; t = Transpose@ Table[(n^2 - n)/2 + Accumulate@ Range[n - 1, n + Ceiling[(Sqrt[9 + 8 nn] - 3)/2]] + 1, {n, Ceiling[(Sqrt[9 + 8 nn] - 3)/2] + 1}]; Table[Reverse@ Take[t[[#1]], #2 - 1] & @@ Flatten@ Position[t, n], {n, nn}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jun 10 2016 *)
results.author: _Peter Kagey_, Jun 08 2016
